item.description:
Across the road from driveway to Hill Barn, directly in line with sycamore tree. Many potholes nearby have been marked for repair so please do this one at the same time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold

item.title: Tall hedge cut down now, 24th May
item.description:
A tall tree hedge has been cut down next to Phoenix Meadow property. It is bird nesting season! No hedge cutting March to August! It is next to a PROW. There is no signage alerting walkers to falling trees. How can this be allowed? This landowner picks bank holiday weekends to do damage, and he knows the council will do nothing. What's the point of rules and regulations if they are flouted and nothing is said.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous place to cross - busy roundabout, 23rd May
item.description:
A zebra or pelican crossing would make this a much safer place to cross. This crossing is used frequently by children and parents on their way to and from school and it is incredible hard to cross as the cards do not stop so take the junction really quickly. It would be so much safer if the crossing was slightly further up the road and if it were an official, marked/lit crossing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Tree is overgrown and a danger to people and property, 23rd May
item.description:
The tree is presenting multiple safety and property hazards. It obstructs visibility when exiting our driveway, which is particularly concerning given that the road is busy and used frequently by children walking to and from school. The reduced visibility creates a significant risk of accidents involving pedestrians and vehicles. In addition, the tree sheds a large number of leaves throughout the autumn, creating a serious slip hazard on both the pavement and our driveway. In the spring, the sap falling from the tree has caused severe damage to the paintwork on our car, resulting in costly repairs. The falling sap has covered and killed multiple plants in our front garden as well as coating the front of our house and all of the front windows to our property which is costly to rectify. Furthermore, during recent storms, the high wind speeds caused the tree to sway dangerously, raising serious concerns about the risk of it falling and causing damage to our home or injury to residents. Given these risks to public safety and property, I would be grateful if the council could prioritise an inspection and advise on the process for its immediate removal. If removal is not feasible, I would like to understand what other mitigation options are available.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven surface on footpath, 23rd May
item.description:

item.title: Trenches across the road after utility work, the eegs of which are deteriorating with age and heavy vehicles, potentially causing significant danger to cyclists, motorists and nearby property., 23rd May
item.description:
Outside 151 Hewlett Road, extending the entire width of the carriageway on both sides of the junctions with Ariel Lodge Road and All Saints Terrace. This problem has also been reported to our County Councillor, with a copy to our MP. We believe that any solution to this problem should include a weight restriction on vehicles passing along Hewlett Road: their passage, particularly at speed, causes our house to shake.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
